desc_EN: Imagine that you are writing a newspaper report of the conversation that took place between the man and the inspector.Answer these questions on the passage.Where necessary,use the words given in parentheses:
desc_CH: 设想一下你正在为报纸写一篇有关探长和嫌疑犯对话的报道。回答以下问题，必要时可用括号内的短语：
note: +++Lines 1-2+++ What did the man say he was doing at the time the murder was committed?
answer: The man said that he was travelling on the eight o'clock train to London at the time the murder was committed.

note: +++Line 3+++ What did the inspector ask him?
answer: The inspector asked him if he always caught such an early train.

note: +++Lines 4-5+++ Did the man say that he did or that he didn't?At what time did he have to be at work?(+++because+++)What would his employer confirm?
answer: The man said that he did because he had to be at work at ten o'clock, and that his employer would confirm that he was there on time.

note: +++Lines 6-7+++ What did the inspector ask him then?
answer: The inspector then asked him if a later train would get him to work on time.

note: +++Line 8+++ What did the man suppose?Did he ever catch a later train?(+++but+++)
answer: The man supposed that it would, but said that he never caught a later train.

note: +++Line 9+++ What did the inspector ask?
answer: The inspector asked at what time he had arrived at the station.

note: +++Line 10+++ At what time did the man say he had arrived at the station?What did he do there?(+++He added that he###+++)
answer: The man said that he had arrived at the station at ten to eight. He added that he had bought a paper and waited for the train.

note: +++Lines 11-12+++ What did the inspector ask him?Did the man say that he had or that he hadn't?(+++When the inspector asked him###the man###+++)
answer: When the inspector asked him if he had noticed anything unusual, the man said he hadn't.

note: +++Line 13+++ What did the inspector suggest?
answer: The inspector suggested that he was not telling the truth and that he did not catch the eight o'clock train, but (caught) the eight twenty-five, which would still get him to work on time.

note: +++Lines 13-16+++ What did the inspector point out?
answer: The inspector pointed out that on the morning of the murder, the eight o'clock train did not run at all, as it had broken down at Ferngreen station and had been taken off the line.

desc_EN: Imagine that you are writing a newspaper report of the conversation that took place between the Ambassador and his wife.Write the passage again using the notes given below:
desc_CH: 假设你正为报社写一篇关于大使和他夫人对话的报道，用以下笔录写出这篇短文：
note: +++Lines 4-7+++ When she asked what###and how###the Ambassador answered drily that a fire extinguisher had been responsible.He then told that###
answer: When she asked what had happened and how his clothes had got into such a mess, the Ambassador answered drily that a fire extinguisher had been responsible. He then told her that university students had set the Embassy on fire that morning. His wife was most surprised and asked him where he had been at the time. The Ambassador answered that he had been in his office as usual. When the fire broke out in the basement, he had gone down to investigate and a man called Horst had aimed a fire extinguisher at him. Horst thought the Ambassador was on fire. The Ambassador said that he must definitely get the fellow posted. His wife suddenly noticed a big hole in her husband's hat and asked him how he could explain it. The Ambassador said that someone had fired a shot through his office window. The shot was accurate, but fortunately he had not been wearing his hat at the time. If he had, he would not have been able to get home for lunch.

note: +++Lines 8-9+++ His wife was most surprised and asked him where ###
+++Lines10-11+++ The Ambassador answered that he###When the fire broke out###he###Omit:‘of course'.

note: The ‘ghost’ was none other than Eric Cox, a third brother who was supposed to have died as a young man. Write three sentences using the following: I suppose; He is supposed; He was supposed. (参见第7课难点）
answer: I suppose this house is very old./He is supposed to speak English very well./ He was supposed to meet me at the station, but he didn’t come.

note: After the funeral, Joe and Bob revealed a secret. They had kept it for over fifty years. Join these two sen­tences then compare your answer with the sentence in the passage. (参见第 2 册第 28 课难点)
He used to sleep during the day. Write two sentences using: He used to work …；He was working …
answer: He used to work here when he was younger ./He was working in the garden when I saw him.

note: without being conscious. Write sentences using verbs after each of the following, instead of; apart form; interested in. (参见第2册第20课关键句型）
answer: I walked there instead of going by bus./Apart from cleaning the windows, he hasn’t done much all day ./I’m not really interested in fishing.

note: He owned a large car. He hardly ever used it. He preferred always to go on foot. Join these three sentences then compare your answer with the sentence in the passage. (参见第 2 册第 49 课关键句型）
he walked into an expensive shop. Write two pairs of sentences illustrating the difference between: into and out of, into and in. (参见第 2 册第 33 课关键句型 b)
answer: He walked into the hotel through the front door, and went out of the hotel by the back door./He went into the restaurant at 6.00 and stayed in the restaurant till midnight!

note: Dickie paid no attention. Write sentences using the following: pay attention, care and take care. (参见第2册第16课难点b)
answer: Please pay attention to your teacher./I don’t care what she does!/Can you please take care of the apartment while we’re away?

note: Recognizing who the customer was …. Write sentences completing the following: I don’t know who ... ;Ask him why…;She asked if... (参见第2册第39课关键句型)
answer: I don’t know who he’s talking about./Ask him why he has never left England./She asked I could phone her.

note: He insisted on the assistants counting the money. Complete the following: Would you mind my…;Imagine her... (参见第2册第68课关键句型b)
answer: Would you mind my opening the window?/Imagine her wearing a dress like that!

note: 30,000 pennies in all. Write sentences using the following phrases: in the end; in debt; in sight; in tears.(参见第2课难点）
answer: At the beginning, the team did very well, but in the end they lost the match./He always owes money to people: he’s always in debt./They never went far out to sea: land was always in sight./I gave her the bad news as gently as I could, but she was in tears when I left.

note: which had been searching the Barents Sea. Write sentences using the following: had been doing and had been working. (参见第2册第62课关键句型b)
answer: She had been doing the job for three years before she gave up./She had been working in the office for three years before she resigned.

note: received. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between receive and take. (参见第2册第4课难点）
answer: Yesterday I received a letter from my brother in Australia/This morning I took it to my mother for her to read.

note: The sect bed was scoured with powerful nets. There was tremendous excitement on board. A chest was raised from the bottom. The crew were at first under the impression that the lost ship had been found. The contents of the chest I proved them wrong. Express these ideas again in not more than two sentences. Compare your answer with I the sentences in the passage. (参见第 2 册第 25, 49 课关键句型）
the contents of the chest. How would the word contents be stressed in this sentence? (参见第 2册第93课难点）
clothing. Write three sentences using the following words: cloth, clothes, and clothing. (参见第2册第81课难点a)
answer: I’ve just cleaned the windows with a new cloth./She has just bought some new clothes from the shop in the square./We should give away all this old clothing.

note: brought. Write three sentences using the following words: bring, take, and fetch. (参见第 2册第29课难点b)
answer: She has just brought me some books from the library ./She took some books back when she left./Can you fetch my glasses from my bedroom please?

note: realized. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between realize and understand. (参见第 2册第20课难点c)
answer: We quickly realized that the old lady was mad./She didn't understand my friend because he only speaks German.

note: We have all experienced days …. Write two sentences using the following, he experience; a lot of experience. (参见第2册第31课难点a)
answer: For the first time in his life he experienced real fear./She has a lot of experience in teaching young children.

note: A day may begin well enough. Write sentences using the Mowing: good enough; enough money, fairly.(参见第2册第86课难点）
answer: This work is just not good enough./I never seem to have enough money to do everything I want to/He's a fairly tall person.

note: You are on the phone. The baby pulls the tablecloth off the table. He smashes half your best crockery. He cuts himself in the process .Join these sentences together to make one sentence. Compare your answer with the sentence in the passage. (参见第2册第49课关键句型）
people recently discovered. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between discover and invent. (参见第2册第61课难点a)
answer: For years they said that Columbus discovered America./I read somewhere the other day that the Chinese invented ice cream.

note: His sitting beside him. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between beside and besides. (参见第2册第18课难点b)
answer: He came and sat down beside me./I’ve got plenty of other books besides these.

note: a lorry driver who was drawing up alongside the car. Explain the meaning of drawing up in this sentence. Write sentences using draw back and draw off. (参见第 2 册第 64 课难点)
answer: drawing up = here, moving, travelling. He drew back when he saw the man with the gun./The taxi waited a few minutes and then drew off.

note: the lorry driver had to sweep up hundreds of broken bottles. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between had to take and should have taken. (参见第 2 册第65课关键句型)
answer: He had to take an exam to qualify as an engineer./I should have taken John’s book back to him last week, but I forgot.

note: when he sees it. Write sentences using the following: the moment he arrives, until he come leave.(参见第2册第60课关键句型c)
answer: I'll phone you the moment he arrives./I'll wait here until he comes./I'll speak to you again before you leave.

note: Explain the difference in the use of must be in these two sentences:To do this, he must be at least as knowledgeable as the dealer. You must be very tired after driving so many miles. (参见第 2 册第 17 课关键句型）
answer: He must be…=He has to be,He needs to be…/You must be very tired…=I assume that you are very tired…

note: Supply a(n) or the where necessary in the following. Do not refer to the passage until you finish the exercise: One Saturday morning, ____Frank visited____ antique shop in my neighbourhood. As he had never been there before, he found____ great deal to interest him. ____ morning passed rapidly and ____Frank was about to leave when he noticed____ large packing case lying on____ floor. ____dealer told him that it had just come in, but that he could not be bothered to open it. ____Frank begged him to do so and____ dealer reluctantly prised it open.____contents were disappointing. Apart from____ interesting-looking carved dagger，____ box was full of____ crockery, much of it broken. (参见第 2 册第 6，30，54 课关键句型）
answer: —，an, a, The, —, a, the, The,—，the, The, an, the,—(See also text.)

note: he noticed. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between notice and remark. (参见第 2 册第41课难点）
answer: Did you notice what she was wearing?/‘It’s a beautiful day，’ he remarked.

note: We might say that justice has been done…. Complete the following sentences: (参见第 2 册第 15课关键句型) He says that____. He wants to know if____. He believes that____.
answer: He says that he has been very busy ./He wants to know if he can do the job now./He believes that he has made a mistake.

note: when a man's innocence or guilt has been proved beyond doubt. Write sentences using the following. The moment he has arrived. Now that you have finished … (参见第 2 册 61 课关键句型 c)
answer: The moment he has arrived, I’ll let you know./Now that you have finished, you can go home.

note: They chipped through a wall. It was eighteen inches thick. They found a man. He had been trapped in the chimney. Join these sentences together to make a single sentence. Compare your answer with the sentence in the passage. (参见第2册第49课关键句型)
they found that a man had been trapped in the chimney. What is the plural of the following words: chimney, valley, baby, day, hobby, army, money, victory, turkey and storey. (参见第 18 课难点）
answer: chimneys, valleys, babies, days, hobbies, armies, moneys or monies, victories, turkeys, storeys

note: Give the correct form of the verbs in parentheses. Do not refer to the passage until you finish the exercise: The sorry-looking, blackened figure that emerged,____(admit) at once that he____ (try) to break into the shop during the night but____ (get) stuck in the chimney. He____ (be) there for nearly ten-hours. Justice (do) even before the man was handed over to the police. (参见第2册第38课关键句型）
answer: admitted, had tried, had got, had been, had been done (Also see text.)

note: We are less credulous than we used to be. In the nineteenth century, a novelist would bring his story…. Supply used to and would in the following: When I was young I____ have a lot more free time than I do now. I____ live near my work and... always get home early. Sometimes I____ do a bit of gardening or go for a long walk. (参见第2册第55课关键句型b)
Readers happily accepted the fact. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between accept and agree. (参见第2册第65课难点b)
answer: We’d like you to accept this present from the class./I agreed to go immediately.

note: the hero’s mother. Supply apostrophes in the following: Georges umbrella; that womans handbag; Keats poetry; the childrens clothes; the soldiers uniforms; in six hours time; a hundred pounds worth. (参见第 1 册第13课难点）
answer: George’s umbrella, that woman’s handbag, Keats’ poetry, the children’s clothes, the soldiers’ uni­forms, in six hours’ time, a hundred pounds’ worth

note: After having been wounded…. Write two sentences beginning with After having been … (参见第2册第69课关键句型）
answer: After having been discovered, he gave himself up to the police./After having been told the way, we found the place with no problem.

note: It is all too easy to blame the railway authorities. Note this pattern. Join the following sentences using the I words in parentheses: (参见第 2 册第 85 课难点）The wall is high. I cannot climb it. (too) The wall is low. I can climb it. (enough)
answer: The wall is too high (for me) to climb ./The wall is low enough (for me) to climb.

note: I could not help noticing. Complete the following sentences. (参见第 2 册第 68 课关键句型）I can't stand____. I don’t mind____.
answer: I can’t stand queueing at the cinema./I don’t mind helping you.

note: Neither was I surprised …Write sentences beginning with the following words: Never… Hardly… Little … (参见第5课难点）
answer: Never had I seen anything like it before ./ Hardly had I started when they told me to stop./Little did she know that she was being watched.

note: seventeen minutes passed. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between passed and post. (参见第2册第33课难点a)
answer: Two minutes passed before anything happened./The time is exactly two minutes past twelve.

note: he denied the train’s existence. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between refuse and deny. (参见第2册第29课难点a)
answer: My friend refused to lend me any money ./He denied that he had stolen the money.

note: I borrowed his copy of the timetable. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between borrow and lend. (参见第2册第11课难点b)
answer: I borrowed three books from the public library ./Then I lent one of them to a friend.

note: 1    Give the correct form of the verbs in parentheses. Do not refer to the passage until you finish the exercise: Up to now, historians I don’t mind____(assume) that calendars I don’t mind____(come) into being with the advent of agriculture, for then man I don’t mind____(face) with a real need to understand something about the seasons. Recent scientific evidence____ (seem) to indicate that this assumption____ (be) incorrect. The nomads who (make) these markings____ (live) by hunting and fishing during the last Ice Age which ____ (begin) about 35,000 B.C. and____ (end) about 10,000 B.C.  (主要参见第2册第29课关键句型）
answer: have assumed, came, was faced, seems, is, have long been puzzled, have been engraved, made, lived, began, ended (See also text)

note: it is connected with. Put with or for after the following verbs: agree, account, mistake, cope, correspond, apologize, blame, reason, satisfied, quarrel, wait, search. (参见第 2 册第 46 课关键句型）
answer: agree with, account for，mistake ... for, cope with, correspond with, apologize for, blame ... for, reason with, satisfied with, quarrel with, wait for, search for

note: between these paintings and the markings. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between between and among. (参见第2册第76课难点b)
answer: What’s the difference between this and that?/When I was with them, I always knew I was among friends.

note: we tried to get Bruce to drive back to the village. Write these sentences again using got in place of made. (参见第2册第66课难点）I made him tell me the truth. He made me translate the article into English.
answer: I got him to tell me the truth ./He got me to translate the article into English.

note: he believed that a car should be driven. Write two sentences beginning: He suggested that ...； He insisted that… (参见第2册第63课关键句型）
answer: He suggested that I should go with him./He insisted that I should stay to lunch.

note: wondering if we were leaving. Complete the following sentences: (1 KS 63d)(参见第 2 册第 63 课关键句型练习d) Can he wait a few minutes longer? I wonder if____ . When will he arrive? I wonder when____.
answer: Can he wait a few minutes longer? I wonder if he can wait a few minutes longer./When will he arrive? I wonder when he will arrive.

note: What a relief it was … . Write these sentences again beginning each one with What: (参见第 2 册第 2课难点）This is a wonderful garden! It is a terrible day!
answer: What a wonderful garden!/What a terrible day!

note: we all got out. Write sentences using the following: get on; get over; and get through. (参见第2册第74课难点a)
answer: How are you getting on in your new job?/She has just got over a serious illness./Did she get through her exams all right?

note: Bruce …told us. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between say and tell. (参见第 2 册第15课关键句型）
answer: He said that the village wasn’t very far away ./He told us that the village was 15 miles away.

note: to put out a nonexistent fire. Write sentences using the following: put up, put someone up, put up with and put up with and put off. (参见第2册第27课难点）
answer: We put up our tent in the comer of the field./Could you put us up for a couple of nights?/We can’t put up with her bad behaviour any longer./They have put of the game until next week.

note: funny to everyone except the victims. Write three sentences illustrating the use of the following: except, except for and apart from. (参见第 2 册第 14 课难点 b)
answer: Everyone found it funny except me./Except for/Apart from this one mistake, your composition is excellent.

note: dressed up. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between dress and dress up. (参见第 2 册第65课难点c)
answer: We all got up, washed, dressed and left the house early ./Most children like dressing up.

note: he could watch. Write two sentences illustrating the difference between watch and follow. (参见第2册第36课难点a)
answer: I watched the whole procession from where I stood./Her eyes followed him wherever he went.
